question.text: Select the incorrect information given regarding ascariasis.

options.text: Common name of causative agent: Round worm
Organ in which adult pathogen is found - Colon.
Symptoms: Internal bleeding, muscular pain, fever, anemia and blockage of the intestinal passage.
Mode of infection: Contaminated soil, water and plants.

solution.text: Ascaris lumbricoides (the common roundworm, an intestinal parasite) causes ascariasis. A roundworm infects a person's small intestine. The mode of infection is by the consumption of soil, water, plants, etc. contaminated with the release of parasite eggs along with the feces of a infected person. The signs and symptoms are intestinal bleeding, muscular pain, fever, anemia and blocking of the intestinal lumen.
